parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions Alexandru Muraru, who is identified as the president of PNL Iași.  While not directly a parliamentary candidate, his role within the PNL, a party participating in the parliamentary elections, creates a strong link. The post also mentions Florin Alexe, a PNL deputy.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The link provided in the post also suggests a news article intended for public consumption.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While framed as a news article, the post focuses on the financial aspects of Alexandru Muraru's campaign, potentially influencing public perception of his candidacy and the PNL's campaign strategy. The negative framing of Muraru's electoral performance could indirectly discourage votes for him and the PNL.  The mention of loans from individuals with political connections raises questions about transparency and potentially undermines public trust in the party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post presents information in a journalistic style, including a link to a news article. However, the selective focus on Muraru's financial struggles and the critical tone suggest a potential bias beyond objective reporting. The overall tone is negative and could be interpreted as an attempt to influence voters.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; rather, it presents information in a way that could be interpreted as negatively influencing public perception of Alexandru Muraru and the PNL.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>458352563600468</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while presented as a news article, uses information about Alexandru Muraru's campaign financing to potentially influence voters' perceptions of his candidacy and the PNL. The negative framing and focus on loans from individuals with political connections raise concerns about the post's objectivity and its potential to sway public opinion against Muraru and the PNL.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement on a public platform further strengthens the argument that it's intended to influence the election.  While it doesn't explicitly urge voters to vote for or against a candidate, the implicit negative message could be considered electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Alexandru Muraru</name>
    <impact>NEGATIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
  <candidate>
    <name>Florin Alexe</name>
    <impact>NEGATIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Moldova Invest</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Moldova Invest, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID 458352563600468) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care, deși prezentată sub forma unui articol de știri, conține informații despre finanțarea campaniei lui Alexandru Muraru, președintele PNL Iași, și a deputatului PNL Florin Alexe, cu scopul de a influența negativ percepția publicului asupra acestora și a PNL.  Postarea, cu un buget de sub 100 RON, a atins între 100.000 și 500.000 de persoane, utilizând un ton negativ și concentrându-se pe împrumuturi de la persoane cu legături politice, subminând astfel încrederea publicului în transparența financiară a PNL.  Această acțiune constituie propagandă electorală, având în vedere că influențează indirect votul, chiar dacă nu îndeamnă explicit la votarea sau ne-votarea unui candidat.  Contact: contact@moldovainvest.newsmoldova.ro, +40772021599, https://moldovainvest.newsmoldova.ro/.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
